headline: Crispy and Creamy Doughnuts
description: This homemade glazed doughnut recipe tastes just the ones from your favorite donut shop: crispy, fluffy, sweet perfection!

video.description: See how to make perfect glazed doughnuts.
video.name: Crispy and Creamy Doughnuts

name: Crispy and Creamy Doughnuts
recipeIngredient: 4 tablespoons hot water or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the yeast over the warm water, and let stand for 5 minutes, or until foamy.

In a large bowl, mix together the yeast mixture, milk, sugar, salt, eggs, shortening, and 2 cups of the flour. Mix for a few minutes at low speed, or stirring with a wooden spoon. Beat in remaining flour 1/2 cup at a time, until the dough no longer sticks to the bowl. Knead for about 5 minutes, or until smooth and elastic. Place the dough into a greased bowl, and cover. Set in a warm place to rise until double. Dough is ready if you touch it, and the indention remains.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface, and gently roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with a floured doughnut cutter. Let doughnuts sit out to rise again until double. Cover loosely with a cloth.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in confectioners' sugar and vanilla until smooth. Remove from heat, and stir in hot water one tablespoon at a time until the icing is somewhat thin, but not watery. Set aside.

Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large heavy skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Slide doughnuts into the hot oil using a wide spatula. Turn doughnuts over as they rise to the surface. Fry doughnuts on each side until golden brown. Remove from hot oil, to drain on a wire rack. Dip doughnuts into the glaze while still hot, and set onto wire racks to drain off excess. Keep a cookie sheet or tray under racks for easier clean up.

review.reviewBody: Made them just as the recipe said and they were fantastic
Wonderful. A taste between hot and cooled glazed doughnuts: they tasted sweeter when cooled. Glaze is awesome I got about 20 doughnuts.

This recipe is incredible! I read all of the comments first and tweaked the recipe accordingly. I ended up blooming the yeast first in the 1/4 cup of warm water with a tsp of the sugar required for the dough. Next, I added all of the ingredients into the bowl of my kitchenaid mixer with paddle attachment. I cut the shortening into tiny cubes and made sure all of my ingredients were room temp. I used half cake flour and half all purpose, roughly 5 3/4 cups. After the first 2 cups, I switches to the dough hook. The dough was STILL a little wet and sticky by the end, but I let it rise anyways and it turned out fine. The dough had an incredible light and fluffy texture and was perfect. I made my donuts with maple glaze, chocolate frosting, cinnamon sugar and powdered with jelly filling. 10/10 would recommend!

I recently made this donut recipe, and it was absolutely delicious. I didn't make the glaze that went with the recipe and substituted brown sugar for the white sugar. These donuts came out light, fluffy and oh so delicious you couldn't just eat one. I made chocolate glazed ones, pineapple glazed ones and cinnamon and brown sugar ones. This recipe is a keeper, and I will be making it again.
The receipe was super easy. Made perfect doughnuts but I steamed some and baked. Great bagels too!

This is such a good recipe. I realized I didn't have enough all purpose flour in the middle of making the dough and so I used bread flour for the last 2 cups needed. The dough was sticky, but I just kept adding a little more flour as needed while kneading it. It turned out great and very close to Krispy Kreme doughnuts.

The directions were clear. Easy to follow. The donuts were an interesting cross between a cake donut and yeasted fried doughnut. Are used confectioner sugar and cream to make the icing, which turned out perfect. I feel the donuts themselves could have tasted a little sweeter. I’ll probably make again, but add a little more sugar this time.

This recipe is great. The only thing I changed was to use cake flour for half of the flour as I wanted to use it up, and I also had to add an extra cup of flour to get just the right consistency for the dough. I believe that was due to the very humid day we had when I made them. They turn out amazing. Melt-in-your-mouth delicious. I did find that I had to turn down the heat on my gas stove as they were getting too dark too fast. When reading the other reviews, I had to laugh at the ones where they said their family said they tasted just like KK. But when my husband said the same thing I couldn't stop laughing. Thanks for such a great recipe.
I loved these donuts, but I had to add a LOT of extra flour to make it into something that could be called dough.

started a grease fire while making these pro tip: don’t spill oil on your stovetop and neglect to clean it up. haven’t fried the rest, but the single burnt one i made was pretty good. another pro tip: don’t forget to put the sugar in the recipe. anyways 5 stars amazing recipe !!
this is extremely nice

This was one of the easiest donut recipes to follow and my first success in making donuts. Just make sure your yeast is active. I have also followed some suggestions to omit the 1/4 cup water and it was perfect. Thank you so much for this recipe!

First time I made them a couple were a little crunchy. But second time, absolutely perfect. I don't have a candy thermometer, but it didn't matter as long as they are coming in a gentle bubble for about 45 seconds to a minute for each side Ave are completely delectable! Tyvm for sharing this.

This recipe is super easy, I used cookie cutters and made heart and flowers shape bite size donuts. They are amazing! 
My family loved them! I will make them again!
Very good recipe. I’m going to try bread flour next time to see how it turns out.
Nice but I made some changes.

Tastes exactly like Krispy cream doughnuts 
Perfect recipe, thank you

This recipe is very good for turning out beautiful, light and crispy donuts, but other reviewers are right. They're not sweet enough. They basically taste like glazed bread, albeit light and fluffy bread. Besides more sugar, there's some other integral ingredient missing, maybe nutmeg or vanilla. I'll have to do some research to figure it out. But it's a very good starting point for light and crispy donuts. I halved the recipe and still got 15 donuts and 20+ donut holes. I made it in my bread machine, very easy. Lastly, I used Splenda instead of sugar and that worked out fine.
Was very good. My 4 year old wasnt impressed with the waiting between steps but well worth it. Super tastey and so many. like so many. I'm gonna have to try freezing some
The doughnuts are delicious. The only thing I noticed was the video shows one packet of yeast but the recipe calls for two. I used two packets and they turned out fine.
First time making doughnuts. These were delicious, the whole family loved them. Made the glaze with milk instead of butter so I didn’t have to heat on the stove. I will be making these again.
Takes a lot of time and I consider it labor intensive for something that's so easy to buy..*BUT* it's an awesome recipe and tastes great so try it!

Great recipe. Due to winter months and house temperature I had to using a heating pad to proof my donuts. Rise was great and better than I expected. I used a 10 x sugar, butter and vanilla drizzle rather than the powered style. Tastes just like the famous ones with the company headquartered in Winston-Salem. Mine were not as consistent and pretty but the taste was dead on!
Phenomenal

If you're on a diet, don't bother making these. All self control will vanish. They are de-lish. I tried putting almond extract in place of the vanilla in the frosting, and it was sooooo good. 
Be forewarned: this recipe makes a lot of donuts. We had to give some away b/c I feared going into sugar shock. Next time I'm going to try a maple glaze and a chocolate glaze.
This recipe is absolutely perfect!! I followed the recipe to the letter and these donuts turned out better than ones you can buy!! Will never buy donuts again!!
Great recipe! Most difficult part was getting the oil at just the right temperature. A candy thermometer is a must. Family loved the doughnuts. They were gone in a flash! Thank you!

It was good, recipe was not too difficult and the rise was quicker then I expected, the cook time was also quick... seeing the donuts and donut holes all cut out i was worried I had got myself in too deep but each batch fried in minutes...
First time making them and the glaze was awesome...i dislike water and milk glazes so that was good. The donut itself was good but a bit denser then i thought it would be... i wanted like a french crueller texture but it was like a regular donut.
It was like the store, again first time so only comparison is store bought but everyone enjoyed.

Made this today with my 32yo son. It was a long process and his first time using yeast but everything came out great. I did make a starter dough last night. And we changed the recipe slightly to make raspberry jelly donuts. Absolutely delicious. I also scalded the milk. The donuts came out light and fluffy. Great even before the filling and icing. Definitely will make again. Yummm.

The only thing I did differently than written was double it. I got exactly 12 doughnuts and 12 holes out of one recipe because I cut 4 inch dough rounds and used the cut holes rather than reconstituting them into the dough to cut. So doubled, I ended up with about 24 doughnuts and 24 holes.

So yeah, just make 'em. Go. Now. Eat those doughnuts.
Love the glazed which I made the donuts out of biscuits can instead of going through all the destruction so I had to make?

I made these vegan and they turned out so good!!! We replaced the milk with Oatley barista blend, the butter with Earth Balance spread, and the eggs with Bob's Red Mill Egg Replacer. The only thing I will change in the future is using the Earth Balance in the glaze, the fake butter flavor was a little overwhelming in that context. I think next time I will do a simple glaze with oat milk or perhaps go for a lemon glaze.
Loved them!
Turned out great! Added pumpkin spice for fall!
Great recipe, have to be patient and let the dough rise. Made nice and fluffy donuts. We only made half what is here!

This recipe is amazing. I have to be honest to tell you that my house was kind of cold this morning, and I believe the yeast did not ferment enough. It did have an aftertaste, and some donuts were really doughy inside. Next time I'll try using my breadmaker for the dough part. Nonetheless, this is what mine looked like!

I actually botched the recipe....after kneading the dough to perfection, I realized I had forgotten the milk.....d’oh! then I remixed everything and these lovely sweet balls of wonder still came out great

This is an awesome recipe!!! This was my first time making any type of dough, and mine turned out amazing. The doughnut was so soft, but the outside was so crispy. The glaze wasn’t even necessary, but it made then even better. I had some left over dough, so I put it into an oven and baked it. It turned out like bread! The dough this recipe yields is beyond.

These are fantastic. They taste like a cross between Krispy Kreme and a good mom-and-pop-shop's raised glazed donut. I make the dough the night before, then let it double overnight in the fridge. The next morning, I set the dough out on the counter for about 45 minutes before proceeding with the rest of the steps. Works out perfectly! 

I also used this as the base for apple fritters and it worked super!
First time making it. Turned out very tasty. Would make again
Literally exactly what I was hoping for. I made no changes and got perfect donuts
I liked it was not to hard to make I added a pinch of cinnamon which I think added great flavor and added shortening instead of butter.

The doughnuts were easy to make and tasty. Personally I found these to taste more like Dunkin’s doughnuts than Krispy Kreme. I wish the dough was a little sweeter, but my husband likes them as written. The glaze was delicious! I also made some with the glaze a little
Just the best ever. By now, I will never use an other recipe for my donuts. Thank you very much!
These doughnuts were tasty, but not what I was hoping for, too heavy & dense
it was amazing! my family enjoyed it so much! can’t wait to make it again!
I made it many times. It is good.
Yes I used chocolate glaze for the doughnuts.
Made these for my kids and they loved them! All I would do differently is add maybe a 1/2 tsp more salt to the dough.
I followed this recipe to a T and they came out perfect
These are better than any doughnut I've ever had from a bakery. My family is crazy about them. I'm not great at describing food, but you won't regret making these.
this was ways to follow, fun and can get the entire family involved. Cost effective and time effective
My family loved these! A huge hit!
Used 2T butter instead of shortening. These were phenomenal.

I didn't make any changes

I made white glaze, chocolate glaze, toasted coconut and cinnamon & sugar for toppings

Absolutely heavenly
I changed the vegetable shorting to lard.
My family LOVED these. We will definitely make again. Huge hit!

Exceeded expectations! light and fluffy.

I cut in small rectangles because I didn't want to mess with the risen dough too much.
Used about 1/3 of a cup more flour
Scrumptious! These just need a light drizzle of sugar on them.
Best donut I have ever made!
maybe the best donuts I ever had.

I didn't make the suggested glaze, instead I made a chocolate one and added a bit of shredded coconut and it was absolutely delicious! I sprinked confectioners sugar on some too. But really they are good to eat without any topping! I would make it again and it's worth the time for sure!
came out great first time!

This was delish!! 

So good Infact, I made it twice ;) 

Co-worker's, family and myself think these 

donuts are outstanding .

Loved them! I did mix the liquids together with the yeast, added sugar and salt and let it sit, then mixed the rest.
The glaze, I did use milk in place of water. 
Good base recipe
These are the best donuts I've ever made!

Straightforward, easy recipe. I don't keep shortening on hand, so I subbed in butter with no problem. My dough was a bit sticky after the initial knead and rise, but using plenty of flour while rolling and cutting took care of it. The donuts puffed up nice and light while frying, and only the very last (overworked) bits of dough ended up a bit dense. I filled some with pastry cream and chose to top all of them with chocolate ganache instead of glaze.
My friend gave me 1 4 her b-day it was sooo good

I made these for the first time, first time making donuts at all actually, and I was very pleased. First off, follow the recipe precisely, there really isn't any need to adjust. I most definitely have Sweet tooth but those that say it isn't sweet enough are crazy, once you glaze them they are more than enough sweet. If you want them sweeter than just double glaze them I guess.

Here are some tips you might find helpful:

1. Depending on the yeast you use you may have to add a 1/4 tsp of sugar to the yeast mixture to get it active and foaming. If it just looks milky after five minutes throw it out and add sugar to the next batch. Temperature matters tremendously with yeast so use a thermometer to make sure the water is around 110°F.

2. I set my oven to "warm" which is under 200°F and placed the covered dough in the oven to rise, again, temperature matters with yeast. It took about 45-60 minutes to rise enough in that warm environment, so if you leave it at room temp it could take longer. Don't rush it though, make sure the dough doubles in size.

3. I cooked the oil to 350°F and that was more than hot enough. One thing I realized is that the doughnuts will continue to cook slightly even after you remove them from the oil, as they drain the hot oil will continue to brown them just a little. I would recommend taking them out before they are "golden brown" to compensate for that. You can practice with the donut holes as I did to get it right.

4. Have fun, you're making donuts!
Made them different size and shape but they where delicious! My husband loved them !! Don’t make them too flat!
I would make these again any time! Delicious!

These were amazing! I had to work with some limitations, so I used almond milk for the milk and canola oil in place of shortening. I’m sure the oil version can’t compare to the creaminess of the shortening version, but they were light, airy and delicious. The dough was stable enough to roll out a second time so I got more than 18 donuts. Will definitely save this recipe.
Amazing one easy to make. And fluffy and crispy i recommend every one to try it
they are Delicious every time my family and friends love it when I make them at Christmas time

So easy! Nice soft dough! Foolproof! A keeper for sure! 
2019-11-24

I really like this recipe. I have used the dough for sweet bread and cinnamon rolls and it works like a charm. Donuts are tricky and time consuming but on a Saturday morning they are worth adding to my to-do list.
Worked out great and my family loved them. At first I thought 2 packs of yeast was too much, but it was perfect.
Holy moly, these are the best donuts I’ve ever had. This is the first time I have ever made donuts AMAZING!!!
Loved this recipe it was easy to make and turned out great the kids LOVED all the donuts

Best donut recipe ever! This is such a great recipe, tastes just like the ones at the bakery! It is light, airy and simply all you would want in a donut, no cake textures at all.

I almost messed up on the yeast, but I put the milk a little bit more to the hot side instead of lukewarm, and the dough rose PERFECTLY.

Super good I made them exactly as the recipe said but they were insanely sweet so I added some cinnamon on top and it was the best thing ever. I made this with my kids and they had a great time, it was a huge mess but worth it

A-mazing!!! My mom, who hates dougnuts, loved these! These are the best dougnuts ever! Thank's so much, Kelly. Definetly will make these again. One note: since I didn't want to use 5 cups off flour, I changed the recipe to serve 11, since I have a family of eight. Loved this recipe, though!

Fabulous! I made the dough in my bread machine which made it so easy. The donut texture turned out so light and fluffy, perfect. For me the glaze is a bit too sweet (due to make of icing sugar I think), but my other half loves them.
Will definitely make them again, next time use lemon juice in the glaze on half and just caster sugar on the rest.
Ps didn't change the recipe at all. :)
Thank you for this recipe these are amazing.
Followed the recipe as written. Excellent recipe! It made 32 donuts & the same amount of donut holes (minus the 1 my grandson ate raw)
They are the most amazing donuts I’ve ever had. This recipe makes a lot of donuts
I tried it for the first time and they were awesome. Our friends liked it too. I used half of all purpose flour and half of wheat flour, they were very good. Thank you for the receipe
I made these for both mini donuts and long johns and they turned out beautifully! I let the first rise go just over an hour in a proofing oven and the second rise was about 40 minutes.

I made it exactly how it says, turned out great whole family loved them. I added some maple syrup to half the glaze and left some plain all great. 
Maybe make the dough a little sweeter.
But they were still great!

This reciepe works even after I botched basically every step. But it was simple to make I was in a eish so I measured with my eye and not actual measuring utensils but still they came out good. I didn’t have a donut cutter so i made a twsited shape and I didn’t want the sugar to come through icing so I made a light glaze and dusted them with coconut. My family LOVED them.
Just okay not worth the effort.

Fantastic classic doughnuts! Exactly what you hope for when you set off to make this recipe. I ended up having to use about 2 cups of whole flour and there was no disappointment. Next time I'll probably try some fillings and cocoa dough.

Considering that I am a novice at baking and have failed many times when trying new recipes, I was super thrilled when this one turned out FAB at first try! Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It delivered what it said. The glaze was amazing too. Thanks so much Kelly!

Before I made this, I read the reviews and paid extra attention to the yeast as adviced by others. Only when I am happy with the foamy yeast did I proceed with the dough. My dough was sticky even after adding all the allocated flour. I was worried at first and pretty sure it will turn out bad because of the weird stickiness. Against my conscience, I went kamikaze and proof it anyway (to double the size). Surprisingly after letting the dough rise, the texture is bouncy and not as sticky. So I can handle the dough more easily to roll and cut it into doughnut rings.

Anyway my point is try to stick to recipe ok. It will be alright in the end.

Omgsh this is the best doughnut dough I've ever made. So light and fluffy and one of those yeast doughs that has the perfect pliable feel. Today I used the dough to make Boston Creme doughnuts! My family is in heaven. I used instant vanilla pudding mix (3/4 cup pudding mix, plus 3 cups of milk) and a chocolate doughnut glaze that is 1 cup chocolate chips, 4T butter, 1t vanilla, and 2.5T corn syrup all melted together. I cannot wait to try more variations. This is delish! Thank you so much for sharing!
Thank you for a wonderful recipe!
These where very good. Defiantly need to double if not triple the glaze to cover all the donuts. This is my new favorite donut recipe. My honey said he fell in love with me all over.

We have been using this recipe for about 8 years! We love it! We have dipped in cinnamon sugar and we have also frosted them with our favorite frostings! My family always get excited when they know I am making them!!
These were amazing. After school my kids wanted donuts so I managed to convince my 7 year old that I would make him some. These were a hit.
